oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Songwriter Session - Leslie Satcher - 2017-05-20
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance by Leslie Satcher from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on May 20, 2017. Includes questions from the audience.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Leslie Satcher;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-in music / (00:15) Opening comments and songwriter introduction by Abi Tapia / (05:17) Opening comments by Leslie / Performs When God-Fearin’ Women Get the Blues / (08:20) Leslie talks about getting songs recorded / (09:29) Performs Tough / (13:00) Leslie talks about the inspiration for the next song / (14:54) Performs When I'm Good And Gone / (17:25) Leslie talks about how long it takes for songs to be recorded / (18:25) Performs That's Alright By Me / (24:07) Answers question when artists take her songs, do they always take both her words and music / (25:10) Answers question about songwriting and how money is made / (27:04) Answers question about George Strait recording her songs / (28:20) Answers question about writing Texas swing type songs / (31:28) Performs You Remain / (34:27) Tells story about Willie Nelson recording You Remain, Bonnie Raitt reaction, people's reaction to the song and the power of a song /

(37:24) Answers question about her song catalog and the importance of owning your songs / (40:36) Answers question about the way Craig Wiseman writes songs, the way she writes songs and where her inspiration comes from / (44:00) Tells about songwriters hearing lines of inspiration together / (45:30) Performs Troubadour / (47:31) Closing comments by Leslie / (47:46) Walk-out music / (48:48) FILE END.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Satcher, Leslie; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
